gestureListeners.transformation

Class Displacement3DListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • gestureListeners.transformation.Displacement3DListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener

    public class Displacement3DListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
    This class lets you displace objects of type AbstractGUIComponent along a plane which you can specify. This means, you can move an arbitrary GUI-component along an arbitrary plane which cuts the position of the GUI-component. This lets you move an object in 3-dimensional space using just two degrees of freedom, so that you can work properly On an ordinary display.
    Version:
    201201029
    Author:
    langenhagen

    • Constructor Detail

      • Displacement3DListener

        public Displacement3DListener(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D normal,
                      org.mt4j.components.MTComponent comp)
        Constructor #1 Creates a new listener with the speceified plane axis relative to the given component's space. If the given component is null, the listener just user global coordinate space.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis of the positioning-plane as a Vector3D
        comp - The component specifying the coordinate space as an MTComponent

      • Displacement3DListener

        public Displacement3DListener(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D normal)
        Constructor #2
        Creates a new listener with the specified plane axis in global coordinates.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis of the positioning-plane as a Vector3D

    • Method Detail

      • processGestureEvent

        public boolean processGestureEvent(org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.MTGestureEvent ge)
        This method will be triggered when the listener will be activated.
        Specified by:
        processGestureEvent in interface org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener

      • setPlaneNormal

        public void setPlaneNormal(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D normal,
                  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent comp)
        Sets the axis of the repositioning-plane according to the specified vector in the coordinate system of the specified component. If the given component is null, global coordinaes are assumed.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis of the positioning-plane as a Vector3D
        comp - The component specifying the coordinate space as an MTComponent

      • setPlaneNormal

        public void setPlaneNormal(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D normal)
        Sets the axis of the repositioning-plane according to the specified vector in global coordinate space.
        Parameters:
        axis - The new axis vector of the repositioning-plane as a Vector3D

      • getPlaneNormal

        public org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D getPlaneNormal()
        Retrieves the repositioning-plane's axis used in this listener in the coordinates specified with setPlaneNormal(), or in the constructor.
        Returns:
        The repositioning-plane' normal as a Vector3D

      • setHome

        public Displacement3DListener setHome(Home home)
        If you bind this listener On a home, you can forward this home to the listener, to manage movement of all items in the home, although they are no real children.
        Parameters:
        home - The home as a Home.
        Returns:
        Returns itself, the Displacement3DListener.

      • getHome

        public Home getHome()
        If you bind this listener On a home, you can forward this home to the listener. This method allows you to retireve the home.
        Returns:
        The home as a Home or NULL if there is no home bound.

      • setMovementRadius

        public Displacement3DListener setMovementRadius(float radius)
        If we bound a Home On this listener, we can say, that the home shall not just be moved within a certain radius. In such a case This method sets the radius of the component to move. This method has no effect if there is no home bound to this listener.
        Parameters:
        maxRadius - The maxRadius to use as a positive float. This radius specifies the maximum radius of a sphere within to move a component in global coordinates. If the number is negative, the maximum movement radius will be zero.
        Returns:
        Returns itself, the Displacement3DListener.
